sentences.chinese: 爬得再高一些，承擔一些風險。

sentences.english: We climbed to the top after an hour.
sentences.chinese: 我們爬了一個多小時纔到達山頂。

sentences.english: He never climbed trees as a boy because he was afraid that he would fall.
sentences.chinese: 他小時候從未爬過樹，因爲他怕跌下來。

sentences.english: The most interesting thing was to climb the Fragrant Mount.
sentences.chinese: 最有趣的事情莫過於爬香山了。

sentences.english: I can creep under the door.
Allen would never climb a tall tree.
sentences.chinese: 艾倫從不爬上高的樹木。

sentences.english: Chen Wenjie holds geminate leg maimed person, climbing beggar arrive for Chen Qingyun capital.
sentences.chinese: 陳文傑裝成雙腿殘廢，爬着要飯供陳青雲到京城。

sentences.english: Climb down nets, and embark the lifeboat over manropes, everyone.
sentences.chinese: 每個人爬下救生網，用扶手繩登上救生艇。

sentences.english: With this thought he cheerfully climbed onto the greenest leaf.
sentences.chinese: 這樣想着他高興地爬上了一片最綠的葉子。

sentences.english: Jeff lowered himself to a ledge five feet down and tried to calm them.
sentences.chinese: 傑夫爬下一塊五英尺高的礁石，欲安撫他們。

sentences.english: The wall is so short that they can climb over.
sentences.chinese: 這堵牆矮到如此程度，以至於他們可以爬過去。

sentences.english: After we’d finished working, we climbed down and picked up our tools.
sentences.chinese: 幹完活後，我們收拾好工具爬下屋頂。
然後我們去爬了峨眉山。

sentences.english: He climbed into the watchtower, but there was no sail.
sentences.chinese: 他爬上瞭望塔，卻看不到船帆。

sentences.english: Black vines crept in and out of windows, through doors and over archways, up the sides of high stone walls.
sentences.chinese: 黑疼爬滿了窗戶，門和拱門，爬上石牆的兩側。
